thread.title: Minneapolis Terminal Area Evacuated In Bomb Scare
thread.title_full: Minneapolis Terminal Area Evacuated In Bomb Scare | Airwise News

author: Reuters
title: Minneapolis Terminal Area Evacuated In Bomb Scare
text:
Part of the Lindbergh terminal at Minneapolis-St.Paul Airport was evacuated briefly and the upper airport roadway closed on Saturday after an unattended bag tested positive for explosives. The north end of the Lindbergh terminal was evacuated at about 1.20 pm and the roadway closed while a bomb squad investigated, airport spokeswoman Melissa Scovronski said.
"It was an unattended backpack on one of the airline ticket counters, on the scale," she said. "One of our officers decided to swab it and it came back positive for explosives.
"The bag... also tested positive when a Transportation Security Administration agent swabbed it, Scovronski said.
The scene was cleared and the terminal reopened about 40 minutes later, she said, after no explosives were found.
Airport police were trying to determine who left the bag on the scale and why it tested positive.
(Reuters)
